<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company selected the
Black-Scholes option valuation model, which is one of the permitted
methods to estimate the fair market value of options under SFAS No.&nbsp;123.
The weighted average fair value </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">62</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='62',FILE='C:\JMS\chanson\05-1814-1\task351074\1814-1-fo.htm',USER='chanson',CD='Mar 15 10:26 2005' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">of
options granted during 2004, 2003 and 2002 was $4.08, $4.97, and $4.30,
respectively. The weighted average estimated fair value of shares granted under
the employee stock purchase plan during 2004, 2003 and 2002 was $2.95, $4.21
and $4.26, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Per share amounts</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Basic net income (loss) per share is computed by
dividing net income (loss) for the period by the weighted-average number
of shares of common stock outstanding during the period. Diluted net income per
share for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2003 and 2002 were computed by
dividing the net income for the period by the weighted average number of common
and potential common equivalent shares outstanding during the period. Potential
common shares are composed of incremental shares of common stock issuable upon
the exercise of stock options or warrants. Diluted net loss per share for the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004 is the same as basic net loss per share for
the same period because the impact of including potential common shares is anti-dilutive.
For year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004, stock options to purchase 1.3 million
shares with exercise prices greater than the average market prices of common
stock were excluded from computation of diluted net loss per share as their
inclusion would be antidilutive.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table sets forth the computation of basic and diluted net income per
share for the periods indicated (in thousands, except per share amounts):</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:20.0pt;">
 <tr>
  <td width="368" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:275.7pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

 <tr>
  <td width="368" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:275.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Basic</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="39" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(0.06</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="39" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.08</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="39" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.41</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF">
  <td width="368" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:275.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Diluted</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="39" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(0.06</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="39" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.08</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="39" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">0.40</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Income taxes</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company accounts for
deferred income taxes under the liability approach whereby the expected future
tax consequences of temporary differences between the book and tax basis of
assets and liabilities are recognized as deferred tax assets and liabilities. A
valuation allowance is established for any deferred tax assets for which
realization is more likely than not.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Comprehensive income (loss)</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No.&nbsp;130
&#147;Reporting Comprehensive Income&#148; (&#147;SFAS No.&nbsp;130&#148;) requires the Company to
display comprehensive income and its components as part of the financial
statements. The Company&#146;s only component of comprehensive income (loss) is
unrealized gains and losses on available for sale securities. Accumulated other
comprehensive income (loss) as of December&nbsp;31, 2004, 2003 and 2002 was
($252,000), $56,000 and $116,000, respectively.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">63</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='63',FILE='C:\JMS\chanson\05-1814-1\task351074\1814-1-fo.htm',USER='chanson',CD='Mar 15 10:26 2005' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
changes in other comprehensive income (loss) were as follows, for the years
ended December&nbsp;31, 2004, 2003, and 2002:</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="SegmentReporting_032657"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Segment reporting</font></i></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Financial Accounting
Standards Board Statement No.&nbsp;131, &#147;Disclosure about Segments of an
Enterprise and Related Information&#148; (&#147;SFAS No.&nbsp;131&#148;) requires that
companies report separately in the financial statements certain financial and
descriptive information about operating segments profit or loss, certain
specific revenue and expense items and segment assets. The Company operates in
one segment, using one measurement of profitability for its business. The
Company has sales outside the United States that are described in Note&nbsp;9.
The vast majority of long-lived assets are maintained in the United States.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="RecentAccountingPronouncements_032657"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Recent accounting pronouncements</font></i></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In March&nbsp;2004, the FASB issued EITF Issue No.&nbsp;03-1,
&#147;The Meaning of Other-Than-Temporary Impairment and Its Application to Certain
Investments&#148; which provides new guidance for assessing impairment losses on
debt and equity investments. Additionally, EITF Issue No.&nbsp;03-1 includes
new disclosure requirements for investments that are deemed to be temporarily
impaired. The adoption of EITF No.&nbsp;03-1 did not have a material effect on
the Company&#146;s financial position, results of operations, or cash flows for the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004. See Note 4, &#147;Fair Value of Financial
Instruments&#148;.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In December&nbsp;2004, the
Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) issued Statement of Financial
Accounting Standards No.&nbsp;123, <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Share-Based
Payment </font></i>(SFAS&nbsp;123R) which will become effective beginning in
the third quarter of 2005. SFAS&nbsp;123R will result in the recognition of
substantial compensation expense relating to our employee stock options and
employee stock purchase plans. The Company currently uses the intrinsic value
method to measure compensation expense for stock-based awards to its employees.
Under this standard, the Company generally does not recognize any compensation
related to stock option grants the Company issues under its stock option plans
or related to the discounts the Company provides under its employee stock
purchase plans. Under the new rules&nbsp;however, the Company is required to
adopt a fair-value-based method for measuring the compensation expense related
to employee stock awards and therefore this will lead to substantial additional
compensation expense that will be included in the Company&#146;s reported results of
operations. The footnote section above entitled <i><font style="font-style:italic;">Stock Based Compensation </font></i>provides the pro forma net income
(loss) and earnings (losses) per share as if the Company had used a fair-value-based
method similar to the methods required under SFAS&nbsp;123R to measure the
compensation expense for employee stock awards during 2004, 2003 and 2002.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="Note2restructuring_032741"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note&nbsp;2&#151;Restructuring</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On November&nbsp;10, 2004, the Company announced its
plan to close the ATMOS research and development facility in Canada to reduce
operating expenses and to further align the Company&#146;s business with market
conditions, future revenue expectations and planned future product direction.
As part of this plan, the Company implemented a reduction in workforce of
approximately 20 employees, which represented 20% of its workforce. In
addition, the Company is attempting to sublease the ATMOS research and
development facility, which the Company occupies under long-term operating
leases through 2008.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">64</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='64',FILE='C:\JMS\chanson\05-1814-1\task351074\1814-1-fo.htm',USER='chanson',CD='Mar 15 10:26 2005' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company recorded restructuring costs of $585,000
in the fourth quarter of 2004, consisting of $179,000 of severance and fringe
benefits and lease abandonment charges of $406,000. </font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">At December&nbsp;31, 2004 the Company has a total
restructuring accrual of $429,000, comprised of unpaid employee severance costs
of $19,000 and estimated lease abandonment costs of $410,000. All employees
affected by the Company&#146;s reduction in workforce were notified of the
termination of their employment on November&nbsp;10, 2004. Estimates related to
sublease costs and income were based on assumptions regarding sublease rates
and the time required to locate sub-lessees, which were derived from market
trend information provided by a commercial real estate broker. The Company
reviews these estimates periodically, if these assumptions materially change
due to rental market factors, the ultimate restructuring expense for the
abandoned facilities would be adjusted.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table summarizes the activities under the 2004 Restructuring Plan:</font></p>

 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF">
  <td width="351" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:263.4pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Less current
  portion</font></p>
  </td>

  <td width="45" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10,051</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.1pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="39" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">564</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="39" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#151;</font></p>

  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">

 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF">
  <td width="357" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:268.0pt;">

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <p style="margin:4.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$&nbsp;11,578</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="12" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.1pt;">

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">65</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='65',FILE='C:\JMS\cmoua\05-1814-1\task353301\1814-1-fq.htm',USER='cmoua',CD='Mar 16 05:47 2005' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In July, 2004, the Company
and Synopsys entered into a settlement agreement (&#147;the settlement&#148;) regarding a
lawsuit arising from the termination by Synopsys of an agreement and plan of
merger and reorganization dated February&nbsp;23, 2004, between the two
parties. Under the terms of the settlement, the Company and Synopsys agreed to
resolve the merger termination lawsuit without further liability or payment
provided Synopsys pay the Company liquidating damages in the amount of $10
million. In July&nbsp;2004, the Company received the $10 million termination
fee. In 2003, other income included the $287,000 contract termination fee from
Conexant.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="Note4FairValueOfFinancialInstrume_032700"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note
4:&nbsp;&nbsp; Fair Value of Financial Instruments</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
estimated fair values of financial instruments outstanding at fiscal year-ends
were as follows:</font></p>

  <td width="255" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt 0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:191.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 20.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">US government debt securities</font></p>

  <td width="11" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt 0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.95pt;">

  <td width="45" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt 0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$&nbsp;17,500</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="11" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt 0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:7.95pt;">

  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.2pt;">

  <td width="12" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.1pt;">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
following table shows the fair value and net carrying amount of cash
equivalents and short-term and long-term investments based on the following two
maturity groups as of December&nbsp;31, 2004:</font></p>

  </td>

 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF">
  <td width="257" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:192.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Due within 1 year</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">There were no realized gains or losses for 2004, 2003
and 2002.</font></p>

</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">U.S. Government Debt Securities.&nbsp;&nbsp; </font></b>The
Company&#146;s investment in U.S. Government Debt Securities consists of low risk
government agency bonds typically with a rating of AAA. The unrealized losses
on the Company&#146;s investments in U.S. Government Debt Securities were caused by
interest rate increases occurred during 2004. Because the Company has the
ability and intent to hold these investments until a recovery of fair value,
which may be maturity, the Company does not consider these investments to be
other-than-temporarily impaired at December&nbsp;31, 2004.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Corporate
Notes.</font></b>&nbsp;&nbsp; The Company&#146;s investment in corporate notes
consists primarily of investment grade corporate bonds and notes. The
unrealized losses on the Company&#146;s investment grade corporate bonds and notes
were caused by interest rate increases occurred during 2004. Due to the fact
that the decline in market value is attributable to changes in interest rates
and not credit quality, and because the severity and duration of the unrealized
losses were not significant, the Company considered these unrealized losses to
be temporary at December&nbsp;31, 2004.</p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">67</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Deferred
tax assets consist of the following (in thousands):</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:20.0pt;">
 <tr>
  <td width="408" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:305.65pt;">

  <td width="124" colspan="7" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:92.85pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">December&nbsp;31,</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.65pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,654</font></p>

  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.65pt;">

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The valuation allowance increased by $2.5 million and
increased by $7.5 million, during the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2004 and
2003, respectively. The valuation allowance at December&nbsp;31, 2004 includes
$3.1 million related to stock option deductions, the benefit of which will be
credited to additional paid in capital when realized.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">As of December&nbsp;31, 2004, the Company had net
operating loss carryforwards of approximately $4.5 million for federal income
tax purposes and approximately $1.3 million for state income tax purposes. These
losses are available to reduce taxable income and expire beginning 2005 through
2024. The Company also had federal research and development tax credit
carryforwards of approximately $1.6 million, which will expire beginning in
2012, and California research and development credits of approximately $848,000
which do not have an expiration date. The Company had foreign tax credits
available for federal income tax purposes of approximately $435,000, which will
begin to expire in 2008. The Company had Canadian net operating loss
carryforwards of $13.6 million, which will begin to expire in 2005. Utilization
of the Company&#146;s net operating loss and tax credit carryforwards may be subject
to a substantial annual limitation due to the ownership change limitations
provided by the Internal Revenue </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">68</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='68',FILE='C:\JMS\ddiana\05-1814-1\task350166\1814-1-fs.htm',USER='ddjacob',CD='Mar 15 13:58 2005' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Code and similar state
provisions. Such an annual limitation could result in the expiration or
elimination of the net operating loss and tax credit carryforwards before
utilization. Management does not believe it is likely that utilization will in
fact be significantly limited due to these provisions.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s U.S. income tax return for 2001 and 2002
are under examination. Management believes that adequate amounts have been
provided for any adjustments that may ultimately result from this examination.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A
reconciliation of income taxes provided at the federal statutory rate (35% in
2004, 2003 and 2002) to actual income tax expense follows:</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
domestic and foreign components of earnings before taxes were as follows for
the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2004, 2003 and 2002:</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:20.0pt;">
 <tr>
  <td width="350" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:262.45pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="70" colspan="4" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:52.25pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">2004</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="39" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:29.0pt;">

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="Note6guarantees_043015"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note&nbsp;6&#151;Guarantees:</font></b></a></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Indemnifications</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the ordinary course of
business, the Company enters into contractual arrangements under which the
Company may agree to indemnify the third party to such arrangement from any
losses incurred relating to the services they perform on behalf of the Company
or for losses arising from certain events as defined within the particular
contract, which may include, for example, litigation or claims relating to
patent infringement. Such indemnification obligations may not be subject to
maximum loss clauses. To date, the Company has not made any payments related to
these indemnifications.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="Note7stockholdersEquity_043029"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note&nbsp;7&#151;Stockholders&#146; Equity:</font></b></a></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Common Stock Option Plans</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The 1992 Stock Option Plan (the &#147;1992 Plan&#148;)
authorizes the board of directors to grant incentive stock options and
nonqualified stock options for up to 3,300,000 shares of common stock to
employees, directors and consultants. Under the 1992 Plan, incentive stock options
are to be granted at a price not less than 100% of the fair value of the stock
at the date of grant, as determined by the board of directors. Nonqualified
stock options are to be granted at a price not less than 85% of the fair value
of the stock at the date of grant, as determined by the board of directors.
Options generally vest over a four-year period </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">69</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='69',FILE='C:\JMS\ddiana\05-1814-1\task350166\1814-1-fs.htm',USER='ddjacob',CD='Mar 15 13:58 2005' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">and are exercisable for a
maximum period of ten years after the date of grant. The 1992 Plan was
terminated in 1996, and no further options were granted under the plan.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 1996, the Company adopted the 1996 Stock Plan (the &#147;1996
Plan&#148;), which authorizes the board of directors to grant incentive stock
options and nonqualified stock options for up to 2,500,000 shares of common
stock to employees, directors and consultants. The option terms under the 1996
Plan are substantially the same as the 1992 Plan except that options granted
under the 1996 Plan may be exercised immediately. Common stock purchased
pursuant to the exercise of an unvested option is subject to repurchase by the
Company, at the exercise price, under certain conditions. Options generally
vest over a four-year period and are exercisable for a maximum period of ten
years after the date of grant.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s 2000 employee stock option plan (the &#147;2000
plan&#148;) was adopted in October&nbsp;2000 in connection with the Company&#146;s
reincorporation in the state of Delaware. In 2004, the Company obtained
shareholders&#146; approval to its <font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Amended and
Restated 2000 Stock Option and Equity Incentive Plan (the &#147;Amended 2000 Plan&#148;) </font>to
<font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">provide additional incentive to our
employees and directors</font>. The Amended 2000 plan authorizes the board or
Committee to grant a broad range of awards in addition to stock options,
including stock grants, restricted stock, performance-based awards,
restricted stock units representing a right to acquire shares in the future and
stock appreciation rights and to determine the applicable terms, including
price, of such awards. Under the Amended 2000 plan, t<font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">he maximum number of shares, which are reserved for issuance is
6,707,000, plus an annual increase of 500,000 on January&nbsp;1 of each year,
or a lesser amount determined by our board of directors. </font>The term of
options granted under the Amended 2000 plan may not exceed ten years. The term
of all incentive stock options granted to an optionee who, at the time of
grant, owns stock representing more than 10% of the voting power of all classes
of the Company&#146;s stock may not exceed five years. Generally, 25% of the options
granted under the Amended 2000 Plan will vest and become exercisable on the
first anniversary of the date of grant, and 1/48th of the options will vest and
become exercisable each month thereafter.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The exercise price of incentive stock options granted
under the Amended 2000 Plan must be at least equal to the fair market value of
the shares on the date of grant. The exercise price of nonstatutory stock
options granted under the amended 2000 plan will be determined by the board of
directors and the exercise price of a nonqualified stock option will not be
subject to any price restriction under the Amended 2000 Plan. No incentive
stock option may be granted to any employee who on the date of grant owns more
than ten percent of our common stock, unless the exercise price of the option
is equal to at least 110% of the fair market value of such shares on the date
of grant. In addition, the Amended 2000 Plan provides for automatic
acceleration of vesting for options granted to non-employee directors in the
event of an acquisition of the Company.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">70</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

2002, 2003 and 2004 and changes during the years ended on these dates are
presented below (in thousands, except per share amounts):</font></p>

  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="51" colspan="3" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:38.3pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Number&nbsp;of<br>
  Shares</font></b></p>
  </td>

  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Weighted<br>

  <td width="359" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:269.35pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.65pt;">

  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.65pt;">

  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.2pt;">

  <td width="37" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:27.85pt;">

  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.25pt;">

  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">

  <td width="4" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="32" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.0pt;">

relating to stock options outstanding at December&nbsp;31, 2004 is as follows
(in thousands, except per share amounts):</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr>
  <td width="172" colspan="3" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:129.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>

</table>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s board of
directors may issue up to 20,000,000 shares of preferred stock without
stockholder approval on such terms as the board might determine. The rights of
the holders of common stock will be subject to, and might be adversely affected
by, the rights of the holders of any preferred stock that might be issued in
the future.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Employee stock purchase plan</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s 2000 employee stock purchase plan was
adopted in October&nbsp;2000 in connection with the Company&#146;s Delaware
re-incorporation, to become effective upon the pricing date of the Company&#146;s
initial public offering. A total of 500,000 shares of common stock have been
reserved for issuance under the purchase plan. In addition, the purchase plan
provides for an automatic annual increase in the number of shares reserved
under the plan on January&nbsp;1 of each year, equal to the lesser of 100,000
shares, one percent of the Company&#146;s outstanding shares of common stock on such
date or a lesser amount </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">71</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='71',FILE='C:\JMS\lsathiya\05-1814-1\task352884\1814-1-fu.htm',USER='lsathiyamoorthy',CD='Mar 16 12:55 2005' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">determined by the board of
directors. The purchase plan, which is intended to qualify under Section&nbsp;423
of the Internal Revenue Code, is administered by the board of directors or a
committee appointed by the board of directors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Employees, including officers and employee directors
but excluding 5% stockholders, are eligible to participate if they are
customarily employed for at least 20&nbsp;hours per week and for more than five
months in any calendar year. The purchase plan permits eligible employees to
purchase common stock through payroll deductions, which may not exceed 10% of
an employee&#146;s compensation. Employees will be permitted to invest a maximum of
$25,000 in any offering period.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The purchase plan has been implemented in a series of
overlapping offering periods, each to be approximately 12&nbsp;months in
duration. Offering periods begin on the first trading day on or after January&nbsp;1
and July&nbsp;1 of each year and end on the last trading day in the period
ending twelve months later. Each participant is granted an option on the first
day of the offering period, and such option will be automatically exercised at
the end of month six of the offering period and on the last day of the offering
period. The purchase price of the common stock under the purchase plan is equal
to 85% of the lesser of the fair market value per share of common stock on the
start date of the offering period or on the date on which the option is
exercised. Employees may end their participation in an offering period at any
time during that period, and participation ends automatically on termination of
employment with the Company. The purchase plan will terminate in June&nbsp;2010,
unless sooner terminated by the board of directors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Of the 500,000 shares
authorized to be issued under the purchase plan, 332,000 shares remained
available for issuance at December&nbsp;31, 2004. Employees purchased 66,000,
55,000 and 47,000 shares in 2004, 2003 and 2002, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Deferred stock-based compensation cost to
employees</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2004, 2003
and 2002, the Company recorded deferred compensation cost of approximately
$74,000, $0, and $314,000 respectively, which cost will be amortized in future
periods. The 2004 deferred compensation cost represents the intrinsic value of
options granted to purchase shares of the Company&#146;s stock to newly appointed
members of the Company&#146;s board of directors that had an exercise price less
than the fair market value of the Company&#146;s common stock on the date of the
option grant. This deferred compensation cost will be amortized over the option
vesting period of 36 months using the graded vesting method. The 2002 deferred
compensation cost represented the shares of common stock issued to certain
employees of ATMOS part of the acquisition that were subject to vesting
requirements, which cost is being amortized over the vesting period of 36
months using the graded vesting method.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2004, 2003
and 2002, the Company recorded stock compensation expenses of $68,000,
$459,000, and $656,000, respectively, of which $50,000, $211,000, and $582,000,
respectively, was attributable to the excess of the fair market value of the
Company&#146;s common stock over the price at which the Company granted stock
options to employees. Stock compensation expenses in 2004, 2003 and 2002 also
included $13,000, $227,000 and $74,000, respectively, for amortization of
deferred compensation cost attributable to the fair market value of shares of
the Company&#146;s common stock issued to certain employees of ATMOS. In addition,
the Company incurred $5,000 of stock compensation expense in 2004 related to
the issuance of options to purchase the Company&#146;s stock to newly appointed
members of the Company&#146;s board of directors that had an exercise price less
than the fair market value of the Company&#146;s stock on the date of the option
grant. The Company also incurred $21,000 of stock compensation expense in 2003
due to modification of the Company&#146;s 2000 employee stock option held a former
member of the Company&#146;s board of directors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Deferred compensation
expense is being amortized using the graded vesting method over the vesting
period of each respective option, generally four years. The accelerated
amortization results in expensing </font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">72</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='72',FILE='C:\JMS\lsathiya\05-1814-1\task352884\1814-1-fu.htm',USER='lsathiyamoorthy',CD='Mar 16 12:55 2005' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">approximately
52% of the total award in the first year, 27% in the second year, 15% in the third
year and 6% in the fourth year.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stockholder Rights Plan</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s Stockholder Rights Plan, which was
adopted in October&nbsp;2000 and became effective June&nbsp;27, 2001, is
intended to protect stockholders from unfair or unfriendly takeover practices.
In accordance with this plan, the board of directors declared a dividend
distribution of one Series&nbsp;AA preferred stock purchase right on each
outstanding share of its common stock held as of June&nbsp;27, 2001, and on
each share of common stock issued by the Company thereafter. Each right
entitles the registered holder to purchase from the Company one one-thousandth
share of Series&nbsp;AA preferred stock at a price of $110. The rights become
exercisable in certain circumstances, including the acquisition by any person or
group, or the commencement or announcement of a tender or exchange offer for
the acquisition, of beneficial ownership of 15&nbsp;% or more of the Company&#146;s
common stock without the approval of the board of directors (except for certain
affiliates prior to the effective date of the Plan as to whom this ownership
limit is 25%). The rights do not confer any rights as a stockholder until they
are exercised. In the event the rights become exercisable, each right will
entitle the holder to acquire shares of common stock of the Company or the
acquiring corporation (in the event of merger or similar business combination)
having a value equal to twice the purchase price of the right. The rights are
redeemable by the Company prior to exercise at $0.01 per right and expire on October&nbsp;11,
2010.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In 2004, the Company
amended its Stockholder Rights Plan twice; once, in connection with the
proposed acquisition of corporation by Synopsys, Inc, and a second time to
permit the acquisition of shares representing more than 15% of its common stock
by a brokerage firm that manages independent customer accounts and generally
does not have any discretionary voting power with respect to such shares.
Notwithstanding amendments of this nature, the Company&#146;s intention is to
maintain and enforce the terms of this plan, which could delay, deter or
prevent an investor from acquiring the Company in a transaction that could
otherwise result in stockholders receiving a premium over the market price for
their shares of common stock.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Stock Repurchase Plan</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On April&nbsp;19, 2004, the Company announced that its
board of directors authorized it to purchase up to $25&nbsp;million of its
common stock over the next 12 months. The share repurchases may be made, from
time to time in the open market subject to market conditions and other factors,
such as the Company&#146;s belief that the repurchase will be beneficial to
stockholders. These repurchases may be commenced or suspended at any time or
from time to time without prior notice. To date the Company has repurchased
approximately $4.7 million or 1.2 million shares of its common stock. All
shares repurchased to date were retired in the third quarter of 2004.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company&#146;s stock repurchases under the above plan are summarized below (in
thousands except for share values):</font></p>

  </td>
  <td width="18" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:13.65pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">73</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='73',FILE='C:\JMS\lsathiya\05-1814-1\task352884\1814-1-fu.htm',USER='lsathiyamoorthy',CD='Mar 16 12:55 2005' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">


<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="Note8retirementSavingsPlan_041926"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note&nbsp;8&#151;Retirement Savings Plan:</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Effective January&nbsp;1997,
the Company adopted the MoSys 401(k)&nbsp;Plan (the &#147;Savings Plan&#148;) which
qualifies as a thrift plan under Section&nbsp;401(k)&nbsp;of the Internal
Revenue Code. All full-time employees who are at least 21&nbsp;years old are
eligible to participate in the Savings Plan at the time of hire. Participants
may contribute up to 15% of their earnings to the Savings Plan. The Company
makes a Matching Contribution on behalf of each Participant in an amount equal
to 25% of a Participant&#146;s Deferral Contributions during the Plan Year. The
Company made matching contributions of $110,000, $107,000, and $98,000 in 2004,
2003 and 2002, respectively.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="Note9businessSegmentsConcentratio_041934"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note&nbsp;9&#151;Business
Segments, Concentration of Credit Risk and Significant Customers:</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has adopted SFAS No.&nbsp;131, &#147;Disclosure
about Segments of an Enterprise and Related Information.&#148; Although the Company
offers various intellectual property components and services to its customers,
the Company does not manage its operations by these intellectual property
components and services, but instead views the Company as one operating segment
when making business decisions. The Company does not manage its operations on a
geographical basis. Revenue attributed to the United States and to all foreign
countries is based on the geographical location of the customer. The Company
uses one measurement of profitability for its business.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company supplies semiconductor memories to the
electronics industry. This industry segment is characterized by rapid
technological change and significant competition.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Financial instruments that potentially subject the
Company to significant concentrations of credit risk consist principally of
cash, cash equivalents short-term and long-term investments and accounts receivable.
Cash, cash equivalents short-term and long term investments are deposited with
high credit quality institutions.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company sells its products and licenses its 1T-SRAM technologies to customers
in the Far East, North America and Europe as follows (in thousands):</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;margin-left:40.0pt;">
 <tr>
  <td width="314" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:235.8pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="168" colspan="8" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:126.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Years&nbsp;Ended&nbsp;December&nbsp;31,</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="314" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:235.8pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="45" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">2004</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>

  <td width="45" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">2003</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="45" colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;border-left:none;border-right:none;border-top:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:34.0pt;">

who accounted for at least 10% of total revenues were as follows:</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Three customers accounted for 46%, 17% and 11% of
gross accounts receivable, respectively, at December&nbsp;31, 2004. Five
customers accounted for 21%, 18%, 12%, 11% and 10% of gross accounts
receivable, respectively, at December&nbsp;31, 2003. The Company has not
experienced any significant credit losses from its accounts receivable and none
are currently expected. The Company performs ongoing</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">74</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='74',FILE='C:\JMS\lsathiya\05-1814-1\task352884\1814-1-fu.htm',USER='lsathiyamoorthy',CD='Mar 16 12:55 2005' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">

<div>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">credit evaluations of its customers&#146; financial
condition and maintains an allowance for uncollectible accounts receivable
based upon the expected collectibility of all accounts receivable. No amounts
were written off in 2004, 2003 and 2002.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Net
property, plant and equipment, classified by major geographic areas were as
follows at December&nbsp;31, 2004 and 2003.</font></p>

  </td>

  </td>
  <td width="32" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:24.0pt;">

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 10.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><a name="Note10commitmentsAndContingencies_043751"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Note&nbsp;10&#151;Commitments
and Contingencies:</font></b></a></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The
Company leases its facilities under non-cancelable operating leases that expire
in 2005 through 2008. Rent expense was approximately $1,157,000, $1,143,000,
and $925,000 for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2004, 2003 and 2002,
respectively. The leases provide for monthly payments and are being charged to
operations ratably over the lease terms. In addition to the minimum lease
payments, the Company is responsible for property taxes, insurance and certain
other operating costs. Future minimum lease payments under the non-cancelable
operating leases as of December&nbsp;31, 2004 are as follows (in thousands):</font></p>

  <p style="line-height:11.5pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1,764</font></p>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 11.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company leases certain
equipment under non-cancelable lease agreements that are accounted for as
capital leases. During Q4 2004 the Company paid in full all capital lease
obligations. Equipment under these capital lease arrangements included in
property and equipment aggregated approximately $176,000 at December&nbsp;31,
2004 and has been fully depreciated. The Company has no non-cancelable purchase
orders outstanding as of December&nbsp;31, 2004.</font></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Legal Matters</font></i></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">On March&nbsp;31, 2004,
UniRAM Technology,&nbsp;Inc. filed a complaint against the Company in the
United States District Court for the Northern District of California, alleging
trade secret misappropriation and patent infringement. UniRAM&#146;s complaint
asserts that it provided trade secret information to Taiwan Semiconductor
Manufacturing Corporation (TSMC) in 1996-97 and speculated that we
improperly obtained unspecified trade secrets of UniRAM from TSMC in an unknown
manner. Subsequent to March&nbsp;31, 2004, UniRAM amended its complaint twice
to add TSMC as a defendant and additional allegations to the suit, and to drop
all infringement claims for one of the two patents identified in the initial
complaint. The Company believes that UniRAM&#146;s complaint lacks merit and intends
to vigorously defend against it.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 5.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">From time to time the
Company may be subject to legal proceedings and claims in the ordinary course
of business. These claims, even if not meritorious, could result in the
expenditure of significant financial resources.</font></p>


 <p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font face="Times New Roman">75</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><a name="schedule"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Schedule&nbsp;II</font></b></a>&#151;Valuation and
Qualifying Accounts<br>
(In thousands)</p>

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">
 <tr>
  <td width="56" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:42.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:left;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:8.0pt;">Description</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="263" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:197.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="font-weight:bold;line-height:8.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></b></p>
  </td>
  <td width="59" colspan="4" valign="bottom" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:44.1pt;">

  period</font></b></p>

  </td>
  <td width="22" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:16.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">200</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.3pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">75</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.65pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.4pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="7" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:5.0pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">$</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="22" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:16.5pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="13" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:9.4pt;">

<div>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">EXHIBIT 23.1</font></b></p>



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><a name="ConsentOfErnstYoungLlpIndependent_035239"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">CONSENT OF INDEPENDENT
REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM</font></b></a></p>





<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">We
consent to the incorporation by reference in the Registration Statement (Form&nbsp;S-8
No.&nbsp;333-64302) pertaining to the <font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">Amended
and Restated 2000 Stock Option and Equity Incentive Plan,</font> 2000 Employee
Stock Purchase Plan, 1996 Stock Plan and 1992 Stock Option Plan of Monolithic
System Technology,&nbsp;Inc., of our reports
dated March&nbsp;15, 2005, with respect to the
consolidated financial statements and schedule of Monolithic System Technology,&nbsp;Inc., Monolithic System Technology,&nbsp;Inc., management&#146;s assessment of the
effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting , and the
effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting of Monolithic System
Technology,&nbsp;Inc., included in this Annual Report (Form&nbsp;10-K) for the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2004.</font></p>
